name: billow
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to spread over a large area, or (especially of things made of cloth) to become filled with air and appear to be larger: Smoke billowed (out) from the burning building. The sheets/shirts hanging on the line billowed in the breeze. We watched the boats with their billowing sails.

a large, moving mass of something, such as smoke or cloud, that spreads over a large area: billows of smoke Sophie stepped into the shower through a billow of steam.
literary a large wave: They were swept by the billows of that savage sea. The wind rushes over the rolling billows, and no ferryboat can cross in such weather.
More examplesFewer examplesThe wind really blew, whipping up huge billows of dust and sand.I flew up and came out on a beautiful clear world with blue sky and billows of clouds just under me.People were whisked away as black billows of smoke rose overhead.
